1707230.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707230.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707230
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 001
1707230.text:
'Umar bin Abu Salamah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), said to me, "Mention Allah's Name (i.e., say Bismillah before starting eating), eat with your right hand, and eat from what is near you."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707240.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707240.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707240
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 002
1707240.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When any of you wants to eat, he should mention the Name of Allah in the begining, (i.e., say Bismillah). If he forgets to do it in the beginning, he should say Bismillah awwalahu wa akhirahu (I begin with the Name of Allah at the beginning and at the end)."

[At-Tirmidhi and Abu Dawud].

1707250.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707250.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707250
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 003
1707250.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
I heard Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "If a person mentions the Name of Allah upon entering his house or eating, Satan says, addressing his followers: 'You will find no where to spend the night and no dinner.' But if he enters without mentioning the Name of Allah, Satan says (to his followers); 'You have found (a place) to spend the night in, and if he does not mention the Name of Allah at the time of eating, Satan says: 'You have found (a place) to spend the night in as well as food."'

[Muslim].

1707260.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707260.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707260
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 004
1707260.text:
Hudhaifah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
When we attended a meal with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), we would not stretch forth our hands towards the food until he (ﷺ) would start eating first. Once, we were with him when a little girl rushed in as if someone was impelling her. She was about to lay her hand on the food when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) caught her hand. Then a bedouin came in rushing as if someone were pushing him. He (ﷺ) caught his hand also and said, "Satan considers that food lawful for himself on which the Name of Allah is not mentioned. He (Satan) brought this girl to make the food lawful through her but I caught her hand. Then he brought the bedouin to make it lawful through him but I caught his hand too. By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, now Satan's hand is in my grasp along with their hands." Then he mentioned the Name of Allah and began to eat.

[Muslim].

1707270.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707270.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707270
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 005
1707270.text:
Umaiyyah bin Makhshi (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was sitting while a man was eating food. That man did not mention the Name of Allah (before commencing to eat) till only a morsel of food was left. When he raised it to his mouth, he said: "Bismillah awwalahu wa akhirahu (With the Name of Allah, in the beginning and in the end)." Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) smiled at this and said, "Satan had been eating with him but when he mentioned the Name of Allah, Satan vomited all that was in his stomach."

[Abu Dawud and An-Nasa'i].

1707280.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707280.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707280
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 006
1707280.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was eating with his six Companions when a desert Arab came and ate up the food in two mouthfuls. Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Had he mentioned the Name of Allah, it would have sufficed for all of you."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1707290.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707290.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707290
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 007
1707290.text:
Abu Umamah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) finished a meal, he would say: "Al-hamdu lillahi hamdan kathiran taiyyiban mubarakan fihi, ghaira makfiyyin wa la muwadda`in, wa la mustaghnan `anhu, Rabbuna. (All praise is due to Allah, praise which is abundant, pure, and full of blessings, which is indispensable and to which one cannot be indifferent).''

[Al-Bukhari].

1707300.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707300.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707300
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 008
1707300.text:
Mu'adh bin Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who has taken food and says at the end: 'Al- hamdu lillahi-lladhi at'amani hadha, wa razaqanihi min ghairi haulin minni wa la quwwatin (All praise is due to Allah Who has given me food to eat and provided it without any endeavour on my part or any power),' all his past sins will be forgiven."

[Abu Dawud and At- Tirmidhi].

1707310.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707310.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707310
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 009
1707310.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) never found fault with food. If he had inclination to eating it, he would eat; and if he disliked it, he would leave it.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707320.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707320.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707320
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 010
1707320.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for sauce and was told that there was nothing except vinegar. He asked for it and began to eat from it saying, "How excellent is vinegar when eaten as sauce! How excellent is vinegar when eaten as Udm!"

[Muslim].

1707330.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707330.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707330
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 011
1707330.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When any of you is invited to a meal, he should accept the invitation. If he is observing Saum (fasting), he should supplicate for the betterment of the host and if he is not fasting, he should eat."

[Muslim].

1707340.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707340.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707340
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 012
1707340.text:
Abu Mas'ud Al-Badri (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
A man prepared some food especially for the Prophet (ﷺ) and invited him along with four others. But a man accompanied him. Having arrived at the door, Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to the host, "This person has followed us. You may allow him, if you like, and if you like he will return." He said: "O Messenger of Allah, I allow him, too."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707350.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707350.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707350
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 013
1707350.text:
'Umar bin Abu Salamah (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
I was a boy under the care of Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and as my hand used to wander around in the dish, he (ﷺ) said to me once, "Mention Allah's Name (i.e., say Bismillah), eat with your right hand, and eat from what is in front of you."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707355.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707355.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707355
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 014
1707355.text:
Salamah bin Al-Akwa' (May Allah be pleased with him) reported on the authority of his father:
A man ate with his left hand in the presence of Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), whereupon he said, "Eat with your right hand." The man said: "I cannot do that." Thereupon he (the Prophet (ﷺ)) said, "May you not be able to do that." It was vanity that prevented him from doing it and he could not raise it (the right hand) up to his mouth afterwards.

[Muslim].

1707360.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707360.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707360
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 015
1707360.text:
Jabalah bin Suhaim reported:
We were with 'Abdullah bin Az-Zubair (May Allah be pleased with them) in a time of famine, then we were provided with dates. (Once) when we were eating, 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) passed by us and said: "Do not eat two dates together, for Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited it, unless one seeks permission from his brother (partner)."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707370.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707370.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707370
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 016
1707370.text:
Wahshi bin Harb (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Some of the Companions of Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "We eat but are not satisfied." He (ﷺ) said, "Perhaps you eat separately." The Companions replied in affirmative. He then said: "Eat together and mention the Name of Allah over your food. It will be blessed for you."

[Abu Dawud].

1707380.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707380.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707380
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 017
1707380.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Blessing descends upon food in its middle, so eat from the sides of the vessel and do not eat from its middle."

[Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi].

1707390.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707390.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707390
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 018
1707390.text:
'Abdullah bin Busr (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) had a large bowl called Al-Gharra', which would be carried by four men. One day, when the Companions finished their Duha (forenoon optional) prayer, Al-Gharra' was brought full of sopped bread, meat and broth, and they sat down around it. When their number increased, Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sat down on his knees and rested on the soles of his feet. A bedouin said to him: "What sort of sitting is that?" Thereupon Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Verily, Allah has made me a courteous slave not a fierce tyrant." Then he said, "Eat from the sides of the bowl and leave the central part of it so that your food will be blessed."

[Abu Dawud].

1707400.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707400.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707400
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 019
1707400.text:
Abu Juhaifah Wahb bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "I do not eat reclining (against a pillow)."

[Al-Bukhari].

1707410.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707410.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707410
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 020
1707410.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
I saw Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) eating some dates while sitting on his buttocks, with his legs raised.

[Muslim].

1707420.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707420.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707420
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 021
1707420.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When one of you finishes eating, he should not wipe his fingers until he has licked them himself or has given them to someone else to lick for him."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707430.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707430.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707430
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 022
1707430.text:
Ka'b bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
I saw Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) eating with three fingers (i.e., the thumb, the index finger and the middle finger) and licking them after having finished the food.

[Muslim].

1707440.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707440.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707440
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 023
1707440.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded the licking of fingers and the gleaning of the dish, saying, "You do not know in which portion the blessing lies."

[Muslim].

1707450.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707450.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707450
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 024
1707450.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When a morsel of any of you falls, he should pick it up and remove any of the dirt on it and then eat it, and should not leave it for Satan nor should wipe his hand with towel until he has licked his fingers, for he does not know in what portion of the food the blessing lies."

[Muslim].

1707460.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707460.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707460
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 025
1707460.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Satan appears at every thing done by you; he appears even at one's dinner. When a morsel of any of you falls, he should pick it up and remove any dirt on it, and then eat it. He should not leave it for Satan, nor should he wipe his hand with the towel until he has licked his fingers, for he does not know in what portion of the food the blessing lies."

[Muslim].

1707470.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707470.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 026
1707470.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Whenever the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ate food, he would lick his three fingers and say, "If anyone of you drops a morsel of food, he should remove any dirt that may have stuck on it and then eat it, and should not leave it for Satan." He (ﷺ) also commanded us that we should glean the pot, saying, "You do not know in which part of your food the blessings lies."

[Muslim].

1707480.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707480.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 027
1707480.text:
Sa'id bin Al-Harith reported:
I asked Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) whether it was obligatory to make Wudu' for Salat (prayer) after eating cooked food. He said: "No, because in the lifetime of Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), such food was rarely available. We had no handkerchiefs, so when we ate such food we would wipe our fingers against our palms, forearms or (the sole of our) feet, and would offer Salat without fresh Wudu' (for prayer)."

[Al- Bukhari].

1707490.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707490.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 028
1707490.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The food of two persons suffices for three persons, and the food of three persons suffices for four persons."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707500.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707500.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 029
1707500.text:
Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The food of one person suffices for two, the food of two persons suffices for four persons, and the food of four persons suffices for eight persons."

[Muslim].

1707510.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707510.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 030
1707510.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to breathe three times in the course of a drink (he used to drink in three gulps).

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707520.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707520.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 031
1707520.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Do not drink in one gulp like a camel, but in two or three (gulps). Mention the Name of Allah (i.e., say Bismillah) when you start drinking and praise Him (i.e., say Al-hamdu lillah) after you have finished (drinking)."

[At- Tirmidhi].

1707530.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707530.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 032
1707530.text:
Abu Qatadah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade breathing into the vessel while drinking.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707540.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707540.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 033
1707540.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Milk mixed with water was brought to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). On his right side was sitting a bedouin and on his left was sitting Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him). He (ﷺ) drank from it and handed the rest to the bedouin saying, "One who is on the right has preference, then again the one who is on the right."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707550.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707550.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 034
1707550.text:
Sahl bin Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
A drink was brought to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he drank (some) from it. On his right was a boy and on his left were some elderly people. He (ﷺ) said to the boy, "Would you permit me to give rest of this drink to these on my left?" The boy said: "O Messenger of Allah, I would certainly not give preference to anyone in anything that might come to me from you." So he (ﷺ) handed over the rest of the drink to him.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707560.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707560.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 035
1707560.text:
Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade turning the water-skin upside down and drinking directly from its mouth.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707570.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707570.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 036
1707570.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited drinking directly out of the mouth of a water- skin.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707580.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707580.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 037
1707580.text:
Umm Thabit Kabshah (May Allah be pleased with her), daughter of Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him) and the sister of Hassan bin Thabit, the Prophet's poet) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) visited me and drank some water from a hanging water-skin while he was in a standing posture. So, I stood up and cut off the mouth (of that water-skin).

[At- Tirmidhi].


An-Nawawi said that the reason why she did this was to preserve the part of the water-skin which the lips of Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) touched, gain blessings from it, and preserve it from dishonor. This narration is understood to show permissibility whereas the previous two narrations are to show what is better and closer to perfection. Allah knows best.

1707590.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707590.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 038
1707590.text:
Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited us blowing in the drinking water. A man said: "O Messenger of Allah! Sometimes I see some litter floating about on the surface. What should I do then?" He (ﷺ) replied, "Pour them out." Then the man said: "My thirst is not quenched with one draught." Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Then put away the cup from your mouth (in between three gulps), and take breath."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1707600.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707600.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 039
1707600.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited us from breathing into the drinking vessel or blowing in it.

[At-Tirmidhi].

1707610.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707610.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 040
1707610.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
I served the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) Zamzam water to drink and he drank it while he was standing.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707620.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707620.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 041
1707620.text:
An-Nazzal bin Sabrah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
'Ali bin Abu Talib (May Allah be pleased with him) arrived at Bab Ar-Rahbah (in Kufah) and drank water in a standing posture. Then he said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing what you have seen me doing."

[Al-Bukhari].

1707630.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707630.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 042
1707630.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) reported:
During the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) we would eat while walking and would drink while standing.

[At- Tirmidhi].

1707640.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707640.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 043
1707640.text:
'Amr bin Shu'aib on the authority of his father and grandfather reported:
I saw Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) drink standing, or sitting.

[At-Tirmidhi].

1707650.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707650.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 044
1707650.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade us from drinking while standing. Qatadah reported: "We asked him: 'What about eating?"' He said: "That is even worse, (or may be he said) more detestable."

Another narration is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) reprimanded [us] for drinking while standing.

[Muslim].

1707660.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707660.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 045
1707660.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "None of you should drink standing; and if any one forgets, he must vomit."

[Muslim].

1707670.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707670.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 046
1707670.text:
Abu Qatadah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who serves others with drinking water should be the last to drink himself."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1707680.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707680.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 047
1707680.text:
Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Once the time for As-Salat (the prayer) approached. Those whose houses were near, went to their houses (to perform Wudu') while some of the people remained with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). A stone (containing some water) bowl was brought for him. It was too small for him to spread his hand over it. He performed his Wudu' and it (the water) sufficed for all the others also. Anas was asked: "How many of you were present there?" He said: "Eighty or more."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim]. This is Al-Bukhari's version.


In Muslim's version "'that Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) called for a container of water so he was given a vessel that had some water.' Anas said 'Then I started looking at the water spouting from his fingers. Then I estimated (the persons) and they were between seventy and eighty.'"

1707691.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707691.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707691
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 048
1707691.text:
'Abdullah bin Zaid (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) visited us and we brought water for him in a brass vessel for his ablution and he performed ablution.

[Al- Bukhari].

1707692.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707692.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707692
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 049
1707692.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) visited the house of a man of the Ansar with one of his Companions and said to him, "If you have some water in the water-skin left over from last night, give it to us for drinking; otherwise, we shall drink from some stream directly."

[Al- Bukhari].

1707700.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707700.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 050
1707700.text:
Hudhaifah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited us from wearing brocade or silk and drinking out of gold or silver vessels and said, "These are meant for them (disbelievers) in this world and for you in the Hereafter."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1707710.book: The Book About the Etiquette of Eating
1707710.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1707710
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 051
1707710.text:
Umm Salamah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who drinks from the vessel of silver kindles the Fire (of Hell) in his belly."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

A narration in Muslim is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Surely, he who eats or drinks in gold and silver vessels fills his belly with Hell-fire."
